publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3733 Robin Harper: Christmas Card Recycling-That the Parliament notes that if every MSP sent every other MSP a Christmas card, over 16,000 cards would be received; therefore welcomes the scheme to recycle Christmas cards whereby between 6 January and 2 February 2003 Christmas cards can be taken to all WH Smith and TESCO stores for recycling, and notes that the funds raised by the scheme will help the Woodland Trust, a leading woodland conservation charity, to create and care for new native woodland in Scotland.
S1M-3733 Christmas Card Recycling (lodged on 20 December 2002) Murdo Fraser*, Sarah Boyack*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Irene McGugan*, Irene Oldfather*, Michael Russell*
S1M-3733 Christmas Card Recycling (lodged on 20 December 2002) Jackie Baillie*, Margaret Jamieson*, Alex Fergusson*, Ms Margo MacDonald*, Mr John McAllion*, Christine Grahame*
S1M-3733 Christmas Card Recycling (lodged on 20 December 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-3733 Christmas Card Recycling (lodged on 20 December 2002) Karen Gillon*
S1M-3733 Christmas Card Recycling (lodged on 20 December 2002) Cathy Peattie*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3733 Christmas Card Recycling (lodged on 20 December 2002) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3733 Christmas Card Recycling (lodged on 20 December 2002) Pauline McNeill*
S1M-3733 Christmas Card Recycling (lodged on 20 December 2002) Iain Smith*, Elaine Smith*
S1M-3733 Christmas Card Recycling (lodged on 20 December 2002) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-3733 Christmas Card Recycling (lodged on 20 December 2002) Susan Deacon*

S1M-3733 Robin Harper: Christmas Card Recyclingâ€”That the Parliament notes that if every MSP sent every other MSP a Christmas card, over 16,000 cards would be received; therefore welcomes the scheme to recycle Christmas cards whereby between 6 January and 2 February 2003 Christmas cards can be taken to all WH Smith and TESCO stores for recycling, and notes that the funds raised by the scheme will help the Woodland Trust, a leading woodland conservation charity, to create and care for new native woodland in Scotland. Supported by: Murdo Fraser, Sarah Boyack, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Irene McGugan, Irene Oldfather, Michael Russell, Jackie Baillie, Margaret Jamieson, Alex Fergusson, Margo MacDonald, Mr John McAllion, Christine Grahame, Nora Radcliffe, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Karen Gillon, Cathy Peattie, Marilyn Livingstone, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Pauline McNeill, Iain Smith, Elaine Smith, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Susan Deacon
